reviews.text: Friendly staff in a pub in one of the best locations. Lovely bay view and outside balcony if the weather is good.
reviews.title: Great setting...

reviews.text: Downfall was the price. Food seemed extortionately expensive for what it was. I had 'Mr Bartons Fish and Chips' it was a bit tasteless.
reviews.title: Fits the bill

reviews.text: Drink was okay, but still at the high end for price. It's the only pub in the village so I guess with the location, they can get away with being more expensive than others.
reviews.title: Restaurant review only: Nice view but bad food and a very long wait
Good pub tasty food
reviews.text: If you want a pub with a view then this must be your destination - almost on the beach with a fantastic view of the bay of Crackington Haven - may not always be the best beer or the best food but in it's own right a pretty good attempt. Large room for children with a pool table, however children are welcome in the main pub too and dogs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a lovely lunch there on Monday and in a stunning spot. Perfect for wandering in from the beach.
reviews.title: Amazing location, great breakfast
